Often the youth cherish objects, pursuits, and pleasures that may not appear to be evil but that fall short of the highest good. They divert the life from its noblest aim. Arbitrary measures or direct denunciation may not avail in leading these youth to relinquish that which they hold dear. Let them be directed to something better than display, ambition, or self-indulgence. Bring them in 


                                                   343 

contact with truer beauty, with loftier principles, and with nobler lives. Lead them to behold the One "altogether lovely."
